text: Hi I Know we can Create and Fetch via the CLI but can we update from JSON via the CLI?

All of our dynamically generated pages are availble in our content dropdown. Not that I know if that is just to be expected or if there is a special sauce. The dev on that was done by <@U24GZQ3GF> from NewBreed+

Hi Rohan, right now we don’t have the ability to update a table using the CLI. The HubDB commands are in developer preview, and we currently only support create, fetch, clear and delete.

We understand the desire for the ability to update.

In the short-term here’s my recommendation - use the update table API <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/update_table>

*Can you share the business use-case you have for why you’d like to be able to update using the CLI?* (having good use-cases helps engineering to determine priorities)

<@UBNBAAQSH> Alternatively, you could set it all within the hubDB table itself. Make a boolean in each row for toggling  the CTA on and off - Text field for what the CTA should be for that page - and Text field for the URL.

You can then build a macro for generating the CTA code and place it wherever you want in the dynamic page.
Found what I think will work for this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/export-to-template-context>
<@UG52C29EE>, so that is not a great option cause then they can do other things
Yea, but right now we do not have such page link field similar to url field..

Is there a way to get the actual URL for videos hosted in the file manager? (really hosted on vidyard?) Trying to set a video in HubDB and then open the file in a modal on the front end. But the only option we get for linking in the file manager is an embed code and the only option we seem to get in hubDB is a video file ID for the video player? Thoughts?
It is not a great solution, but we use a regular text field for the user to paste the video URL in.
